title: [Polygon Mumbai] erigon stops every hour: unable to handle whitelist milestone
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon version 2.53.4-c4843268`

OS & Version: Linux Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS

Erigon Command (with flags/config):
```
nohup erigon --datadir $DATA_DIR \
  --chain=mumbai \
  --bor.heimdall=http://localhost:1317 \
  --snapshots=false \
  --torrent.upload.rate="512mb" --torrent.download.rate="512mb" \
  --ws \
  --private.api.addr=localhost:9091 \
  --txpool.globalslots 131072 \
  --txpool.globalbasefeeslots 60000 \
  --txpool.globalqueue 131072 \
  --metrics \
  --http \
  --http.addr 0.0.0.0 \
  --http.api 'eth,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool,bor,admin' \
  --http.vhosts '*' \
  --http.port 8545 \
  --maxpeers 30 \
  --p2p.protocol=67 \
  --db.pagesize=16k \
  --db.size.limit 7697000000000 \
  --log.console.verbosity='debug'\
  >> ~/node/logs/bor.log \
  2>&1 &
```
Consensus Layer: heimdalld (v1.0.2)

Consensus Layer Command (with flags/config):
```
# heimdalld
nohup /home/ubuntu/go/bin/heimdalld start --home /home/ubuntu/.heimdalld —-chain=mumbai --rest-server \
  >> ~/node/logs/heimdalld.log \
  2>&1 &

# heimdalld-rest-server
nohup /home/ubuntu/go/bin/heimdalld rest-server --home /home/ubuntu/.heimdalld \
  >> ~/node/logs/heimdalld-rest-server.log \
  2>&1 &

```

added some debugging logs to see where the problem is starting.
we've figured out that verifying part is where the problem starts. 
(https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/blob/c4843268b788c0899cdad12d220fea4396afbb56/consensus/bor/finality/whitelist_helpers.go#L85)

Restarting the erigon client solvese the problem(it syncs well and works well again). But before we manually restart the erigon client, the logs shared above will repeat and it won't sync.
This happens every hour or so, and this happened after upgrading from v2.49.1 to v2.53.0 to prepare for the Agra Hardfork.
We've reported this issue by discord(https://discord.com/channels/687972960811745322/983710221308416010/1167370610289168445, Oct.27) This has been a problem since then but no changes were made to fix this bug by v2.53.4.
We are still manually restarting the node whenever this bug happens.

Please look into the issue.

Hey @DaraDoyoung, thanks for reporting the issue. 

Could you let me know if the heimdall endpoint is working correctly or not? Basically, can you try doing a simple curl request to fetch latest milestone? Sharing the endpoint below:
```
curl http://localhost:1317/milestone/latest
```

I believe that it's unable to reach the heimdall endpoint as it says `context deadline exceeded` when querying and get's timed out. 

Moreover, a quick nit pick. I believe you're printing `config.heimdall` for debugging but looks like it doesn't have arguments in correct form. It should have odd number of params like `log.Info("Message", "value1", value1, "value2", value2)`. You can try changing that to confirm if the heimdall config is correct.
